page.title: 10THE SPA AT PURTON STOKE
page.content: In the 19th century was the opening of the spa.In the 1850,s the well was owned by Dr.S.C. Sadler who at first filled it in.The villagers were upset by this; they said it had been used for years and cured them when they were ill.Sadler didn't believe them.When he became seriously ill, he tried some himself:he was cured. The well was used for about 200 years. In September 1859 a pump room was erected around it.The official opening was a Gala Day.It must have been one of Purton Stoke's busiest days; but by 1880 visitors were no longer allowed. Mr Neville took over in 1927 and tried to revive its trade.He continued to sell bottles by pony and trap.The last entry in the sales ledger was in 1952 when the cost of one bottle was 8d.
